meanings.definition: People or things that are not deserving of respect or consideration.
meanings.sent1: The unworthies were not invited to the party.
meanings.sent2: She refused to associate with the unworthies in the group.
meanings.sent3: The unworthies tried to sneak into the exclusive club but were caught.
meanings.sent4: The unworthies lurked in the shadows, hoping to go unnoticed.
meanings.sent5: The unworthies stood out like sore thumbs among the distinguished guests.

meanings.definition: To consider someone or something as not deserving of respect or consideration.
meanings.sent1: He unworthies those who do not meet his high standards.
meanings.sent2: She unworthies any criticism that comes her way.
meanings.sent3: The teacher unworthies any student who cheats on the test.
meanings.sent4: The judge unworthies those who show no remorse for their actions.
meanings.sent5: The coach unworthies players who do not put in their best effort.
